content: Make your cash top-up or CPF transfer early to earn more through the power of compounding interest. If you make a top-up in January instead of December, you can earn up to 20% more interest in just 10 years on those monies.

metadata.header:
Retirement top-ups and transfers

What you need to know before making cash top-up or CPF transfer

Quick tip
metadata.content: Make your cash top-up or CPF transfer early to earn more through the power of compounding interest. If you make a top-up in January instead of December, you can earn up to 20% more interest in just 10 years on those monies.

content: Receive up to $8,000 tax relief when you make a cash top-up to yourself and up to another $8,000 when you make a cash top-up to your loved ones (parents, parents-in-law, grandparents, grandparents-in-law, spouse and siblings) in each calendar year. The top-up amount you or your loved ones can receive and tax relief you can enjoy depends on the recipient’s age and CPF balances. Tax relief only applies to givers and not recipients.

Yourself and your loved ones

The top-up amount you or your loved ones can receive and tax relief you can enjoy depends on the recipient’s age and CPF balances. Tax relief only applies to givers and not recipients.

content: Boost your employees’ retirement savings by making cash top-ups on your employees’ behalf. By doing so, you will benefit from dollar-for-dollar tax deductions while your employees may enjoy tax relief of up to $8,000.

content: You can transfer your Ordinary Account (OA) savings to your Special Account (SA) if you are below 55. If you are above 55, you can transfer your CPF savings to your Retirement Account (RA), Your SA savings will be transferred first, followed by your OA savings. How much you can transfer depends on your age and CPF balances.

metadata.header:

Yourself
metadata.content: You can transfer your Ordinary Account (OA) savings to your Special Account (SA) if you are below 55. If you are above 55, you can transfer your CPF savings to your Retirement Account (RA), Your SA savings will be transferred first, followed by your OA savings. How much you can transfer depends on your age and CPF balances.

content: Before transferring your CPF savings to your loved ones, you have to first set aside enough for your own retirement. The amount of CPF transfers you can make to them depends on how much your loved one can receive, and the amount you can transfer.

content: You can enjoy an equivalent amount of tax relief for cash top-ups made in each calendar year of up to: $8,000 if you make a top-up to yourself and an additional $8,000 if you make a cash top-up to your loved ones. Please note that only cash top-ups up to the current Full Retirement Sum (FRS) are eligible for tax relief. Log in with your Singpass to find out how much you can top up to yourself. If you make cash top-ups to your loved ones, please note that the tax relief does not apply to your recipients. Find out the conditions to qualify for tax relief. If you are an employer making cash top-ups on your employees’ behalf, you will receive an equivalent amount of tax deductions for the cash top-ups. Additionally, your employee can receive up to $8,000* of tax relief per calendar year.

metadata.header:
Retirement top-ups and transfers

How much tax relief can I enjoy when I make cash top-ups?
metadata.content: You can enjoy an equivalent amount of tax relief for cash top-ups made in each calendar year of up to: $8,000 if you make a top-up to yourself and an additional $8,000 if you make a cash top-up to your loved ones. Please note that only cash top-ups up to the current Full Retirement Sum (FRS) are eligible for tax relief. Log in with your Singpass to find out how much you can top up to yourself. If you make cash top-ups to your loved ones, please note that the tax relief does not apply to your recipients. Find out the conditions to qualify for tax relief. If you are an employer making cash top-ups on your employees’ behalf, you will receive an equivalent amount of tax deductions for the cash top-ups. Additionally, your employee can receive up to $8,000* of tax relief per calendar year.

content:
The conditions for you to enjoy tax relief when you make cash top-ups to yourself, your loved ones or employees are as follows: 
 - You can enjoy tax relief of up to $8,000 if you make a top-up to yourself; and an additional $8,000 if you make a cash top-up to your loved ones or employees. 
 - For cash top-ups to self and your loved ones, tax relief is only up to the current Full Retirement Sum (FRS). Log in with your Singpass to see how much you can top up to yourself. 
 - There is a personal income tax relief cap of $80,000, which applies to all tax reliefs, including tax relief on cash top-ups made to your CPF accounts. 
 - The tax relief cap will be shared for cash top-ups to Special Account (SA)/Retirement Account (RA) and/or cash top-ups to MediSave Account (MA) *. Find out more about the amount of tax relief you can enjoy. 
 - If you make cash top-ups to your loved ones, please note that tax relief does not apply to your recipients. 
 - Your loved ones include parents, parents-in-law, grandparents, grandparents-in-law, spouse and siblings. 
 - If you are making cash top-ups to a spouse or sibling, you will only be eligible for the tax relief if the recipient's income in the previous year does not exceed $4,000 or if the recipient is handicapped^. In this instance, income would include income from bank interest, dividend and pension, investment income/rental income/directorship income. An example of a handicapped person is someone with visual-impairment, loss of hearing, loss of limb and dementia. 
 - If you are making a cash top-up to the SA/RA of your employee on his behalf, you will be eligible for an equivalent amount of tax deductions for the cash top-ups made. While such a cash top-up will be included in your employee's taxable income, your employee will receive tax relief of up to $8,000 for cash top-ups made in each calendar year. The tax relief that your employee will receive also takes into consideration any cash top-ups that he has made to his own SA/RA and MA. 
 - If you would like to make a CPF contribution to your employee’s MA as an employer, please do so under the Additional MediSave Contribution Scheme (AMCS) to be eligible for tax deduction on your contribution. AMCS contributions are tax-free for employees.

metadata.header:
Retirement top-ups and transfers

What are the conditions for me to enjoy tax relief?
metadata.content:
The conditions for you to enjoy tax relief when you make cash top-ups to yourself, your loved ones or employees are as follows: 
 - You can enjoy tax relief of up to $8,000 if you make a top-up to yourself; and an additional $8,000 if you make a cash top-up to your loved ones or employees. 
 - For cash top-ups to self and your loved ones, tax relief is only up to the current Full Retirement Sum (FRS). Log in with your Singpass to see how much you can top up to yourself. 
 - There is a personal income tax relief cap of $80,000, which applies to all tax reliefs, including tax relief on cash top-ups made to your CPF accounts. 
 - The tax relief cap will be shared for cash top-ups to Special Account (SA)/Retirement Account (RA) and/or cash top-ups to MediSave Account (MA) *. Find out more about the amount of tax relief you can enjoy. 
 - If you make cash top-ups to your loved ones, please note that tax relief does not apply to your recipients. 
 - Your loved ones include parents, parents-in-law, grandparents, grandparents-in-law, spouse and siblings. 
 - If you are making cash top-ups to a spouse or sibling, you will only be eligible for the tax relief if the recipient's income in the previous year does not exceed $4,000 or if the recipient is handicapped^. In this instance, income would include income from bank interest, dividend and pension, investment income/rental income/directorship income. An example of a handicapped person is someone with visual-impairment, loss of hearing, loss of limb and dementia. 
 - If you are making a cash top-up to the SA/RA of your employee on his behalf, you will be eligible for an equivalent amount of tax deductions for the cash top-ups made. While such a cash top-up will be included in your employee's taxable income, your employee will receive tax relief of up to $8,000 for cash top-ups made in each calendar year. The tax relief that your employee will receive also takes into consideration any cash top-ups that he has made to his own SA/RA and MA. 
 - If you would like to make a CPF contribution to your employee’s MA as an employer, please do so under the Additional MediSave Contribution Scheme (AMCS) to be eligible for tax deduction on your contribution. AMCS contributions are tax-free for employees.

content: Matched Retirement Savings Scheme, Launched in 2021, MRSS aims to help senior Singapore Citizens with lower retirement savings build up more. This will boost their monthly payouts in retirement. MRSS will first run for five years during which, the Government will match every dollar of cash top-ups made to the RA of eligible members up to $600 per year. This would amount to a maximum of $3,000 over five years.

metadata.header:
Matching grant with the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme

MRSS
metadata.content: Matched Retirement Savings Scheme, Launched in 2021, MRSS aims to help senior Singapore Citizens with lower retirement savings build up more. This will boost their monthly payouts in retirement. MRSS will first run for five years during which, the Government will match every dollar of cash top-ups made to the RA of eligible members up to $600 per year. This would amount to a maximum of $3,000 over five years.

content: You’ll get a dollar for dollar matching grant from the Government for any top-ups received in your RA if you’re eligible for MRSS, up to an annual cap of $600.

metadata.header:
Matched Retirement Savings Scheme

Benefits

Dollar for dollar matching grant
metadata.content: You’ll get a dollar for dollar matching grant from the Government for any top-ups received in your RA if you’re eligible for MRSS, up to an annual cap of $600.

content: Your cash top-up and matching grant from the Government in your RA will earn risk-free interest rates* of up to 6% per annum. This means you get to enjoy higher payouts in retirement.

metadata.header:

Benefits

Interest rates
metadata.content: Your cash top-up and matching grant from the Government in your RA will earn risk-free interest rates* of up to 6% per annum. This means you get to enjoy higher payouts in retirement.

content: If you make a cash top-up to yourself and to eligible members, you’ll also qualify for tax relief of up to $16,000 per calendar year. If you’re an employer who would like to make cash top-ups for your employees, you’ll also qualify for tax deductions as an employer.

content: Your eligibility is automatically assessed every year. The CPF Board will notify you at the beginning of each year if you qualify and you can also check your eligibility via the website once the assessment is completed. As long as you’re eligible and you receive a cash top-up, you’ll receive the matching grant by the following year.

- Singapore citizen

 - Property ownership: Own not more than one property

content: Simply make cash top-ups to your RA anytime within the year. The matching grant of up to $600 a year will be automatically credited into your RA at the beginning of the following year. QUICK TIP, You don’t have to make a lump sum cash top-up. Instead, make smaller top-ups whenever you can. For example, if you top up $50 per month for an entire year, you’ll be able to qualify by the end of the year to get the maximum $600 matching grant.

metadata.header:
Matched Retirement Savings Scheme

How to receive the grant

Top up to your RA
metadata.content: Simply make cash top-ups to your RA anytime within the year. The matching grant of up to $600 a year will be automatically credited into your RA at the beginning of the following year. QUICK TIP, You don’t have to make a lump sum cash top-up. Instead, make smaller top-ups whenever you can. For example, if you top up $50 per month for an entire year, you’ll be able to qualify by the end of the year to get the maximum $600 matching grant.

content: We will assess your eligibility for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme (MRSS) annually at the beginning of the year. You do not need to apply as your eligibility is automatically assessed. If you are eligible, we will notify you via email or post. You can also check your eligibility through the MRSS eligibility checker.

metadata.header:
Matched Retirement Savings Scheme

When will my eligibility for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme be assessed and do I need to apply?
metadata.content: We will assess your eligibility for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme (MRSS) annually at the beginning of the year. You do not need to apply as your eligibility is automatically assessed. If you are eligible, we will notify you via email or post. You can also check your eligibility through the MRSS eligibility checker.

content: Yes, you will be eligible for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme as long as you are 55 in the assessment year and meet the eligibility criteria. If you are turning 55 this year and your Retirement Account has not been created at the time we assess your eligibility, your total Special Account and Ordinary Account savings will be assessed instead.

metadata.header:
Matched Retirement Savings Scheme

Will I be eligible for Matched Retirement Savings Scheme if I am turning 55 later this year?
metadata.content: Yes, you will be eligible for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme as long as you are 55 in the assessment year and meet the eligibility criteria. If you are turning 55 this year and your Retirement Account has not been created at the time we assess your eligibility, your total Special Account and Ordinary Account savings will be assessed instead.

content: If you are eligible for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme and have received cash top-ups in that year, you can expect to receive the matching grant in your Retirement Account at the beginning of the following year.

metadata.header:
Matched Retirement Savings Scheme

When will I receive the matching grant?
metadata.content: If you are eligible for the Matched Retirement Savings Scheme and have received cash top-ups in that year, you can expect to receive the matching grant in your Retirement Account at the beginning of the following year.

content: Take advantage of CPF’s interest when you make a voluntary housing refund of the Ordinary Account (OA) savings used for your property. You will need to refund less and get to receive more cash proceeds when selling your property.

metadata.header:
Voluntary housing refunds

Make a voluntary housing refund before selling your property
metadata.content: Take advantage of CPF’s interest when you make a voluntary housing refund of the Ordinary Account (OA) savings used for your property. You will need to refund less and get to receive more cash proceeds when selling your property.

content: You can make a voluntary housing refund if you’ve used your Ordinary Account (OA) savings for your property.

metadata.header:
Voluntary housing refunds

Eligibility

Who is it for?
metadata.content: You can make a voluntary housing refund if you’ve used your Ordinary Account (OA) savings for your property.

content: The earlier you refund your CPF savings, the less you’ll need to refund upon the sale or transfer of the property. Keep in mind that the mandatory amount to refund includes funds used to pay for the property and any interest you would’ve earned if the funds had remained in your CPF account.

metadata.header:
Voluntary housing refunds

Benefits

Less amount needs to be refunded to your CPF savings when selling your property.
metadata.content: The earlier you refund your CPF savings, the less you’ll need to refund upon the sale or transfer of the property. Keep in mind that the mandatory amount to refund includes funds used to pay for the property and any interest you would’ve earned if the funds had remained in your CPF account.

Voluntary housing refunds

application

Make a voluntary housing refund

content: If you are 55 and above and have made a voluntary housing refund, the refunded amount will be used to meet your cohort's Full Retirement Sum (FRS). The FRS helps to meet your retirement needs and ensure that you receive monthly payouts during your retirement. Any refunds that exceed your cohort’s FRS in your Retirement Account will remain in your CPF Ordinary and/or Special accounts. This means that your voluntary housing refund can help meet your retirement needs and provide a steady stream of income during your retirement years.

metadata.header:
Voluntary housing refunds

Is my voluntary housing refund used to set aside my Retirement Sum if I am 55 and above?
metadata.content: If you are 55 and above and have made a voluntary housing refund, the refunded amount will be used to meet your cohort's Full Retirement Sum (FRS). The FRS helps to meet your retirement needs and ensure that you receive monthly payouts during your retirement. Any refunds that exceed your cohort’s FRS in your Retirement Account will remain in your CPF Ordinary and/or Special accounts. This means that your voluntary housing refund can help meet your retirement needs and provide a steady stream of income during your retirement years.

content: When you make a voluntary housing refund, you can refund up to the principal CPF withdrawn towards the property (including the CPF Housing Grant) plus its accrued interest to your CPF account. Generally, the housing grant will be refunded to your Ordinary Account. If you have received more than $30,000 in housing grants, part of the housing grants may be credited to your Special Account/Retirement Account and MediSave Account. Check your Home ownership dashboard to see the amount that will be credited to your Special/Retirement Account and MediSave Account. These savings that are credited to your Special Account/Retirement Account and MediSave Account can then be used for approved purposes under the various CPF approved schemes to help you with your healthcare and retirement needs.

metadata.header:
Voluntary housing refunds

Do I have to refund the housing grant to my CPF account when I make a voluntary housing refund of the monies withdrawn for my property?
metadata.content: When you make a voluntary housing refund, you can refund up to the principal CPF withdrawn towards the property (including the CPF Housing Grant) plus its accrued interest to your CPF account. Generally, the housing grant will be refunded to your Ordinary Account. If you have received more than $30,000 in housing grants, part of the housing grants may be credited to your Special Account/Retirement Account and MediSave Account. Check your Home ownership dashboard to see the amount that will be credited to your Special/Retirement Account and MediSave Account. These savings that are credited to your Special Account/Retirement Account and MediSave Account can then be used for approved purposes under the various CPF approved schemes to help you with your healthcare and retirement needs.

content: For cash top-ups to MediSave Account, the amount is subject to your BHS. Once your BHS has been reached, no further top-ups can be made to your MediSave Account. If you exceed your BHS from the top-up,  your top-up will be fully refunded to you.

metadata.header:
MediSave top-ups

Things to note when making top-ups to your MediSave Account

Top-up limit to your MediSave Account and Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS)
metadata.content: For cash top-ups to MediSave Account, the amount is subject to your BHS. Once your BHS has been reached, no further top-ups can be made to your MediSave Account. If you exceed your BHS from the top-up,  your top-up will be fully refunded to you..

content: Cash top-ups made are irreversible. Once you have decided to top up your MediSave Account, you can do so via the CPF website

MediSave top-ups

Payments
metadata.content: You can use our e-Cashier to check the amount of top-ups you can make.

content:
Voluntary top-ups cannot be made solely to the Ordinary Account. You can make voluntary top-ups to: 
 - Special / Retirement Account only under the Retirement Sum Topping Up Scheme (RSTU) (tax relief available). 
 - All three CPF accounts (no tax relief given) 
 - MediSave Account only (tax relief available for Giver). Voluntary top-up is applicable to Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents only. You can find out more on which voluntary top-up is applicable to you.

metadata.header:
MediSave top-ups

Can I voluntarily top-up to my Ordinary Account only?
metadata.content:
Voluntary top-ups cannot be made solely to the Ordinary Account. You can make voluntary top-ups to: 
 - Special / Retirement Account only under the Retirement Sum Topping Up Scheme (RSTU) (tax relief available). 
 - All three CPF accounts (no tax relief given) 
 - MediSave Account only (tax relief available for Giver). Voluntary top-up is applicable to Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents only. You can find out more on which voluntary top-up is applicable to you.
